intro: Psychotria aubletiana var. centroamericana, commonly known as the Central American Psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to Central America and parts of northern South America, typically growing in moist, shaded forest understories. The plant is characterized by its simple, elliptical leaves and small, clustered white or pale green flowers. It produces small, dark blue to black berries that are often consumed by birds and other wildlife. Due to its habitat requirements, it is often found in humid, tropical environments with well-drained soil.
